title: Options for Deleting Contacts on Android: Contacts App and Google Contacts

steps.title: Open Contacts.
steps.content: Open Contacts. The app is a blue silhouette of a person. Use this method if you use Google Contacts to manage your phone book.

steps.title: Tap a contact to delete.
steps.content: Tap a contact to delete. A new page will open with that contact's information. If you want to delete multiple contacts, press and hold a contact until you see a checkmark on their profile name, then tap to select more entries.

steps.title: Tap ⋮.
steps.content: Tap ⋮ . This three-dot menu is in the top right corner. Skip this step if you have multiple contacts selected.

steps.title: Tap Delete.
steps.content: Tap Delete . Confirm your action by tapping Move to Trash . If you have more than one contact selected, tap the trashcan icon and select Move to Trash to confirm. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Tap the Contacts or People app.
steps.content: Tap the Contacts or People app. The name of the app will vary depending on what Android device you are using.

steps.title: Tap the contact you want to delete.
steps.content: Tap the contact you want to delete. This will open the contact's details. If you want to delete multiple contacts, you may be able to press and hold the first contact until the selection mode activates, then tap each additional contact you want to select. This functionality varies depending on your device.

steps.title: Tap Delete.
steps.content: Tap Delete . The location and look of this button will vary, but it can generally be found at the top or bottom of the screen. It may say "Delete," or it may look like a trashcan. You may have to tap ⋮ first and then select Delete .

steps.title: Tap Yes or Move to Trash to confirm that you want to delete the selected contacts.
steps.content: Tap Yes or Move to Trash to confirm that you want to delete the selected contacts. You'll be prompted to confirm that you want to permanently delete the contact(s) from your device.
